message.body: Hey, I hear you're having some trouble with the computer?
Yeah.can't get online..i think it said my updates expired..i prally shut something off..i should know more about computers but..........
Ok. Next time you see the message can you send me exactly what it says? I'm sure we can figure it out
You can also bring it to my parents' house and see if you can get on the wireless there just to rule out the hotspot as the problem
Wait. Did it say this: the Security Certificate has expired or is no longer valid?
Do i have to renew updates?
Yes sonething along those lines
If it's asking you to pay for something definitely don't do it. That could be malware
But if it was something like that your computer's date and time clock could just be messed up
I'll send you some instructions on how to reset the date and time and you can see if that works
Press the Windows Key + D keys on your keyboard or click Desktop tile from the Start screen to show Windows 8 Desktop.
Then right click the clock at the bottom right corner and select "adjust date/time". Click Change Date & Time. Set to the right date, time, and zone. Hit ok.
See if that fixes it and let me know!
Ok ill check it out later..thanx
(1/2) Its the settings on the pc.. Was on with sprint and they had me activate the hotspot on"open" and it connected..his diagnosis was that settings on the pc
(2/2) are messed up...im so computer stupid
At least it's working now. Next time I'm up there for the weekend I can look it all over if you want
I put it back on the security thing..i dont want to leave it open..i check my bank crap on there......afraid someone gets my info..
Yeah, good call
I dont understand why it connects on an open network tho..
Are you sure the security type (wep, wpa, etc) and the password are right?
We changed all that three times
